c74object:
Query retuning for a MIDI note at signal-rate
â€‹
Query the MTS-ESP library for the frequency and retuning amount for a given MIDI note at signal-rate. If the MIDI channel (1-16) on which the note was received is known it should be sent to the right inlet, else set right inlet to 0.
The left outlet outputs the absolute frequency value.
The middle outputs the retuning as a ratio from the standard 12-TET tuning for the given MIDI note number.
The right outlet outputs the deviation in semitones from 12-TET tuning.
Oliver Cash MTS-ESP Microtuning
MIDI note number
MIDI channel if known (1-16), otherwise 0
Depends on inlet
In left inlet: A signal representing a MIDI note number value. Note value is converted to int and clamped to range [0,127] before calculating output values.
In right inlet: A signal representing the MIDI channel on which the note was received. Channel value is converted to int and clamped to range [0,16]. Set to 0 (default) if unknown, else use 1-16.
Depends on inlet
In left inlet: MIDI note number. Numbers can be used instead of signal objects to MIDI note number. If a signal is also connected to the inlet, any numbers sent to the left inlet will be ignored.
In right inlet: Set the MIDI channel (1-16) on which the note was received, if known, else set to 0 (default). Numbers can be used instead of signal objects to MIDI channel. If a signal is also connected to the inlet, any numbers sent to the right inlet will be ignored.
Depends on inlet
In left or right inlet: converted to int.
